page.title: 15GUNTHWAITE SPA.
page.content: The group stopped in front of the spa and filled a bottle with the water. It smelt of rotten eggs. The smell was sulphurdioxide. This water is supposed to have a medicinal effect. The water is best drunk on the first Sunday of May, when it is believed to cure ailments.There is a walk to the spa on this day to celebrate this custom and the spa is a very popular tourist attraction. Now the spa is walled off, but the water can be obtained by a tap in the side of the wall. The path leading past the spa has a large stone wall, with a ring for tethering horses, embedded in it. At the rear of the spa is a sign saying: ' THE PURITY OF THIS WATER CAN NOT BE GUARANTEED. IT IS ADVISABLE TO BOIL IT BEFORE DRINKING.' Public Services Department.
